Pre-Game Insights: Scotland manager Steve Clarke mentioned the team's pride in qualifying for back-to-back tournaments and their hopes for a special performance.
Scott McKenna believes the fans will be a boost for the squad.
The team includes key players such as Billy Gilmour, John McGinn, and captain Andy Robertson.
How are Scotland preparing for the big g: Scotland had their final training session on Thursday morning ahead of the European Championship opener in Munich.
The team was in good spirits during their warm-up.
What about the fans?: Scotland fans, nicknamed the 'Tartan Army', have been going all out for the team ahead of Friday's game.
Thousands have travelled from the UK to Munich, with dedicated supporters having driven, flown, or even bussed it to Germany.
An estimated 200,000 fans are expected to head over during the next few weeks of the competition.
